formalText: Their partner ended up being awake for New Year's Eve, but they didn't get to do anything romantic mostly because he was sick and said they were disappointed.
They think they are having a hard time getting along because it stems from their partners depression.
They are looking for a job and are having a hard time turning in their applications.
They have started to turn in one application a week.
They are working on being productive with their time.
They used to think they sound mad but they don't think they sound mad.
They told him well, why don't they record the next fight they had and then they can listen to their voice.
Their partner just shuts down when they start to argue.
They think their partner is irresponsible for the time when they take their medication because it effects their next day plan which frustrates the patient.
They felt his desire to watch like listen to those lectures that night at that point was more important than like being intimate with them, which frustrated them.
They feel hurtful about being angry.
They feel like they are taking out their frustrations from something else on him.
If he says he's sorry, that just makes them more angry.
They feel like they are taking on a lot of the responsibility.

When their partner got sick they still make him food and even when they were sick or like do crazy things like emptying the dishwasher at his place standing on a chair while dizzy, which they really should not have been doing and things like that, but when he's sick and they were panicking because he's sick.
They are struggling with their parents sending them places to apply to and some of those jobs not having details on whether they will be paid from the job.
They feel like they don't deserve a trip if they don't have a job.
